name: SVGGeometryElement
description: The SVGGeometryElement interface represents SVG elements whose rendering is defined by geometry with an equivalent path, and which can be filled and stroked. This includes paths and the basic shapes.

members.name: SVGGeometryElement.pathLength
members.description: This property reflects the pathLength attribute.

members.name: SVGGeometryElement.isPointInFill()
members.description: Determines whether a given point is within the fill shape of an element. Normal hit testing rules apply; the value of the pointer-events property on the element determines whether a point is considered to be within the fill.

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: A DOMPoint interpreted as a point in the local coordiante system of the element.

members.name: SVGGeometryElement.isPointInStroke()
members.description: Determines whether a given point is within the stroke shape of an element. Normal hit testing rules apply; the value of the pointer-events property on the element determines whether a point is considered to be within the stroke.

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: A DOMPoint interpreted as a point in the local coordinate system of the element.

members.name: SVGGeometryElement.getTotalLength()
members.description: Returns the user agent's computed value for the total length of the path in user units.

members.name: SVGGeometryElement.getPointAtLength()
members.description: Returns the point at a given distance along the path.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: A float referring to the distance along the path.
